Notes: Psycholinguistic research has linked de pendency length minimization to the ease of processing (Grodner & Gibson, 2005) and cross-linguistic investigations have found evidence for this preference at the level of language structure (Futrell, Mahowald, & Gibson, 2015) suggesting a correlation between processing performance and grammar. Prior work, however, has not directly tested the causality underlying this correlation.
In Experiment 1 , we directly probe the causal link between processing biases in individual language learners and the preference for shorter dependencies observed cross - linguistically.
